result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Svacina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling, treatment or combination to equal full-time.

records.addlTxt: Motion to Withdraw.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is denied for the reasons stated on the record.

09:43 AMDefendant Michael A. Svacina in court.  Attorney Ann M. Larson and Attorney Nathan Heim in court for Michael A. Svacina.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail as the defendant is unable to post the amount previously set. State objects to any modification.
The court feels that it would be a grave disservice to the community and too big of danger for the defendant to flee the jurisdiction. if bail is modified and therefore denies the motion to modify bail.
Attorney Larson indicates that there are significant conflicts of interest in this case and she will be filing paperwork to withdraw and a new attorney will be appointed through the Public Defender's Office.
Motion hearing on March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail Motion.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody in Manitowoc County Jail.

It is hereby ordered that the defendant's Motion to modify bond is denied.

records.addlTxt:
Preliminary held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Attorney Heim argues for bail to be modified to a lower cash amount.
State objects to bail modification.
Court denies motion to modify bail.  State to draft order.
Status conference set for 02-28-2022 at 1:30pm (riding with IA's in 21CF965 and 22CF89)
Offer Deadline:  03-25-2022
Scheduling conference 04-20-2022 at 10:00am
Minutes.

2:30 PM Defendant Michael A. Svacina appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Michael A. Svacina, Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has not applied for Public Defender representation in 21CF965 or 22CF89.
Attorney Larson has been trying to meet with the defendant regarding 22CF90 but has been unable to do so yet. The matters are set over. 
The defendant is willing to waive the time limits in which a preliminary hearing must be held. 
Court finds good cause to toll the time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Bail Motion
Ann Larson, public defender.
Nathan Heim, Public Defender.

2:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael A. Svacina appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant, in person. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 01-28-2022
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree reckless homicide, deliver Fentanyl and 4 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with any member of the victim's family and that he not possess any controlled substances.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
